intro: Cryptantha taltalensis, commonly known as the Taltal cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. The plant is adapted to thrive in saline and rocky soils, often found in coastal areas with strong winds. Its growth habit is low and sprawling, with hairy stems that help reduce water loss. Cryptantha taltalensis plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh environment and is of interest to botanists studying halophytic plants.
